title: About
text:
Privacy
This webpage does not use any cookies. It does not collect, store or process personal data. The website is hosted by GitHub Inc. using GitHub pages. The privacy statement of Github is available here.

title: Young Researchers in Archaeometry
section: A workshops series from ECRs for ECRs
text:
A workshops series from ECRs for ECRs
YRA aims to give young archaeometry researchers the opportunity to present their research in a friendly environment surrounded only by young students from the same field. We welcome all persons involved in archaeometry research of different nationalities and levels, from master students to first postdoctoral fellows.

title: Video tutorials
text:
Mailing list



Want to get in contact with other ECRs in Archaeometry and stay tuned about YRA?
Subscribe to our mailing list!








Contact



Any questions? Drop us a mail at youngresearchersarch@gmail.com
Video tutorials were produced by international experts for YRA 5 | 2022 as an adaptation of the highly demanded in-person tutorials of YRA 4 | 2021 to the online-only format. They are hosted on YouTube in our channel. Originally presented at this edition’s webpage, they are listed here for convenience.
We are happy to extent the collection! If you have a tutorial you want to include, please reach out to us.

title: Video tutorials
text:
Bioarchaeology

Kelly Blevins (Durham University):  aDNA in Bioarchaeology – Applications and sampling strategies
Friðgeir Grímsson (University of Vienna):  Is pollen useful for archaeological research? The what, why, and how!

title: Video tutorials
text:
Archaeological Materials

Sabine Klein (Deutsches Bergbau-Museum Bochum):  Archaeometallurgy - What metals tell us about the past
Artemios Oikonomou (Cyprus Institute):  Reflecting into ancient glass technology
Alexandra Rodler (ÖAI/ÖAW):  Colorful Indications of (Ex)Change – pigment provenance and processing in Roman Noricum

title: Video tutorials
text:
Methods

Eleni Palamara (University of Peloponnese):  Electron Microscopy techniques – Applications in archaeological research
Walter Prochaska (ÖAI/ÖAW):  Application of the ion chromatography in archaeology
Katrin J. Westner (ENS Lyon):  ICP-MS techniques and their applications in archaeometry
